title: Ticket #2785: Allow square brackets in IPv6 address in NETWORK_INTERFACE
description:
When specifying an IPv6 address in NETWORK_INTERFACE you may not put square brackets around the address. So: 

# This is valid:
NETWORK_INTERFACE =  2607:f388:107c:506::ce

# This is not valid:
NETWORK_INTERFACE = [2607:f388:107c:506::ce]

Since everywhere else, Condor not only allows but requires the square brackets, for consistency it would be nice if NETWORK_INTERFACE allowed them as well.
remarks:
2017-Dec-19 11:57:41 by jfrey:
Using square brackets in an IPv6 address in NETWORK_INTERFACE works in Condor 8.6 and 8.7. Abandoning this ticket.
creator: adesmet
